name: cut
desc: `cut` command line can extract specified columns from text files, or cut specified parts of files and output the results to standard output.

-b.name: Only display data from the beginning of the line to the specified byte

-c.name: Only display data from the beginning of the line to the specified character
-c.desc: For example: the 3rd character: '3'; the first 10 characters: '1-10'

-d.name: Replace TAB key with specified delimiter

-f.name: Only display specified columns, separate multiple columns with commas

-s.name: Replace space key with specified delimiter

--complement.name: Complement, only display columns not specified

content:
Examples

  • Display the first 10 characters of a file: cut -c 1-10 file.txt
  • Display the third character of a file: cut -c 3 file.txt
  • Use comma as delimiter, display the second and fourth columns of a file: cut -d ',' -f 2,4 file.txt
  • Display all columns except the first and third columns of a file: cut -f 1,3 --complement file.txt
